JATOS with Apache

This is an example for a configuration of Apache as a proxy in front of JATOS. It is not necessary to run JATOS with a proxy but it’s common.

The following is the content of Apache’s httpd.conf. Change it to your needs. You probably want to change your servers address (www.example.com in the example). If you want to use JATOS with group studies you have to add the mod_proxy_wstunnel module.

LoadModule proxy_module modules/mod_proxy.so
…
<VirtualHost *:80>
  ProxyPreserveHost On
  ServerName www.example.com
  ProxyPass  /excluded !
  ProxyPass / http://127.0.0.1:9000/
  ProxyPassReverse / http://127.0.0.1:9000/
</VirtualHost>
